name: Devstack Alert: Traefik 5xx Error Rate.txt - Check the cluster for which the alert is fired
description: This section explains that if you don't have access to the clusters where the Traefik 5xx error rate alert is being triggered, you can use the devstack onboarding scripts to gain access. This allows you to investigate and troubleshoot the issue within the relevant clusters.

name: Devstack Alert: Traefik 5xx Error Rate.txt - Get access to the clusters using the devstack onboarding scripts
description: This section provides a step to check the status of the Traefik pods, which are responsible for handling incoming traffic and routing it to the appropriate services. It suggests verifying if the Traefik pods are running and in a healthy state, which can help identify potential issues related to traffic routing or service availability.
use_cases: Monitoring the health of the Traefik ingress controller
Identifying potential issues with traffic routing

name: Devstack Alert: Traefik 5xx Error Rate.txt - Check if the traefik pods are running and in healthy state
description: This section suggests checking the registered targets for the dev-automation Application Load Balancers (ALBs) to ensure that the Traefik pods, which are responsible for routing traffic, are running and in a healthy state. If the Traefik pods are not running or are unhealthy, it could lead to 5xx errors, indicating server-side issues.
use_cases: Monitoring the health of Traefik pods
Verifying the registered targets for dev-automation ALBs

name: Devstack Alert: Traefik 5xx Error Rate.txt - Check the registered targets for the dev-automation ALBs
